title.native: ラブライブ！虹ヶ咲学園スクールアイドル同好会
title.romaji: Love Live! Nijigasaki Gakuen School Idol Doukoukai
title.english: Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club

description:
Nijigasaki High School is known for their diverse subjects and the freedom they give to students. Second-year student Yuu Takasaki has been turned on to the charms of school idols, so she knocks on the door of the School Idol Club with her friend, Ayumu Uehara. Sometimes friends, sometimes rivals, the members of this club each contribute their own thoughts and motivations to the group.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: เลิฟไลฟ์ ชมรมสคูลไอดอลนิจิกะซากิ
Лав Лайв! Клуб айдолов академии Нидзигасаки

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ohkowai/status/1446500402275373056)

Takumi Yokota is an animator and character designer that is currently freelance. He was formerly affiliated with ufotable, Anime International Company (AIC), and Shaft.

After graduating from university from the Faculty of Law department, he joined ufotable as a production assistant. He stated in an interview with Akiba Souken in 2019, that while watching movies and anime at the library in his third or fourth year of job hunting, he fell in love with the work Patlabor: The Mobile Police, directed by Mamoru Oshii. And while watching Oshii's interview, he decided that he wanted to become a director, and when he was researching on how to become a director, he found out that one of the paths of becoming a director is by starting out as a production assistant; and so he applied as a production assistant at ufotable. He later left ufotable due to various reasons and described himself as a NEET for almost half a year after departing from ufotable. After more than three months of being a NEET, he thought to himself that he really needed to get a job, and then remembered his time as a production assistant at ufotable. While still working as a production assistant at ufotable, a conversation with an animator at ufotable stuck with him, and thought subsequently: "Let's go back to anime again!" And in 2007, he applied as an animator at Anime International Company (AIC) when he saw that the studio was hiring 20 new animators, and got the position. He made his debut as an animator with 2007's Tokyo Majin, co-animated by AIC Spirits and BeSTACK. He has stated that while at his time at the studio, AIC took care of its animators well so that they could live, and was occasionally treated by his seniors at the studio. He cites Ryuichi Makino as one of his mentors while at AIC. In 2011, he made his debut as an animation director in 2011, with AIC's adaptation of R-15 of the same name. In 2013, he made his character designer debut with Pupipo!, animated by AIC PLUS+. In 2014, he left AIC and became an animator at Shaft. As of December 2019, he has become freelance.

Sakurako’s work is based on her own experiences, with [Sister Princess](https://anilist.co/manga/38414/) coming from having a brother, [Strawberry Panic!](https://anilist.co/manga/34974/) coming from attending an all-girls school, and [Baby Princess](https://anilist.co/manga/38676/) from having a lot of cousins.
__Yukako Takesawa__ is a Japanese music producer.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

__Aliases:__ ポッキー (Pocky), 社長 (President)

__Shunji Inoue__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger, producer and animation planner. He founded the music publishing company Lantis in 1999 and became its president.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/6_kai)__

__Residency:__ Yokohama, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Yoshihide Mukai__ is a Japanese visual effects specialist and CG artist.
